column1: Bhainsdehi is a town and a nagar panchayat in Betul district  in the state of Madhya Pradesh
column2: India. Kukru is the second highest point of Mahadeo hills. Bhainsdehi holds the position of being the originating place of the river Purna. It is predominantly a tribal Tehsil. Bhainsdehi is surrounded by the mountain ranges of Satpura.

column1: Bhainsdehi is located at 21.65°N 77.63°E﻿ / 21.65; 77.63. It has an average elevation of 741 metres (2

column3: 756. Males constitute 51% of the population and females 49%. Bhainsdehi has an average literacy rate of 70%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%; with 56% of the males and 44% of the females literate. 14% of the population is under 6 years of age.
